name: Mitochondrial Neurogastrointestinal Encephalopathy (MNGIE)
chief_complaint: I've been having severe stomach pain, vomiting, and I can't seem to gain weight no matter how much I eat.
prognosis: Poor without treatment; progressive neurological and gastrointestinal deterioration leading to death typically in early adulthood. Stem cell transplantation may halt progression.
description: MNGIE is an ultra-rare autosomal recessive disorder caused by mutations in the TYMP gene leading to thymidine phosphorylase deficiency. This results in toxic accumulation of thymidine and deoxyuridine, causing mitochondrial DNA instability. The condition affects multiple systems with prominent gastrointestinal and neurological involvement.
